IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Safety Observation on hESC Derived MSC Like Cell for the Meniscus Injury
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: Safety Observation on Human Embryonic Stem Cell (hESC) Derived Mesenchymal Stem Cells(MSC) Like Cell for the Meniscus Injury

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: human embryonic stem cell derived mesenchymal stem cells like cell for the meniscus injury, and observe the safety of the cells for meniscus injury
DescriptionModule.DetailedDescription: Three different dosage of human embryonic stem cell derived mesenchymal stem cells like for meniscus injury patients, and observe the safety of the cells for meniscus injury.

ArmGroupInterventionName: Biological: hESC derived MSC like cell

Intervention.InterventionDescription: Different dosage of hESC derived MSC like cell for the meniscus injured patients

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: The change in number of adverse events based on the National Cancer Institute-Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: Adverse events include：allergic reactions, local reactions or infections at the injection site and muscle or skeletal dysplasia
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeTimeFrame: 1 week, 1 month, 2months and 3 months after the injection of MSC Like Cell

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: baseline, 1 week, 1 month, 2months and 3 months after the injection of MSC Like Cell

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: VAS is a psychometric response scale which can be used in questionnaires. It is a measurement instrument for subjective pain. The scale range is from 0 to 10, the higher the score, the more severe the pain.
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: baseline, 1 week, 1 month, 2months and 3 months after the injection of MSC Like Cell

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: to use the goniometer to measure the range of knee motion
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: baseline, 1 week, 1 month, 2months and 3 months after the injection of MSC Like Cell

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: The scale is to assess the function of knee. The scale range is from 0 to 100, the higher the score, the more severe the knee problems. This scale includes 8 items, and the total score is the sum of these 8 items' scores. Individual items are scored differently, using individual scoring scales: 1. limp (0,3,5), 2. support (0,2,5), 3. locking (0,2,6,10,15), 4. instability (0,5,10,15,20,25), 5. pain (0,5,10,15,20,25), 6. swelling (0,2,6,10), 7. stair climbing (0,2,6,10), 8. squatting (0,2,4,5).
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: baseline, 1 week, 1 month, 2months and 3 months after the injection of MSC Like Cell
baseline, 1 week, 1 month, 2months and 3 months after the injection of MSC Like Cell

EligibilityModule.EligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

Grade Ⅰ-Ⅱ meniscus injury of knee joint
The patients who still have the pain of knee joint and/or limitation of the function after accepted 3 months of nonoperative treatment

Exclusion Criteria:

Recent history of lower limb fractures or intra-articular drug injection
The patients who have meniscus injury of knee joint need the surgical repair
The patients who have the severe coagulation disorders, cardiopulmonary failure and so on
The women who are pregnant or nursing
There are electronic implants such as pacemakers in the body
The patients who are infected the HIV, the virus of hepatitis or syphilis
The patients who are alcoholism or drug user
The patients who have vestibular and balance disorders
The patients with severe cognitive impairment who cannot follow instructions to complete the treatment
The patients who don't sign the informed consent
The patients who have tumor
Immunodeficiency patients
The patients who have congenital or acquired knee malformation
Patients or researchers who are participating in other clinical trials believe that other reasons are not appropriate for clinical trials

Location.LocationFacility: Tongji Hospital, Tongji Medical College of Science and Technology
